title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS (AP) — It was not a game. It was a coronation. In a performance for the ages, Shaquille O’Neal delivered a breathtaking and brutal display of power, single-handedly dismantling the Dallas Mavericks as his Los Angeles Lakers cruised to a 102-83 victory.

From the opening tip, the Dallas defense was merely a formality. O’Neal was an unstoppable force, a titan in the paint who treated double-teams as minor inconveniences. He poured in a staggering 46 points, a figure that didn't just lead all scorers—it dwarfed them. His 21 rebounds were a testament to his sheer dominance on both ends of the floor, as he controlled the game's rhythm with the authority of a king. The Mavericks had no answer, no solution for the avalanche of points in the post.

While Shaq’s supporting cast played their roles effectively—Nick Van Exel’s 15 points and Eddie Jones’s 14 provided necessary perimeter balance—this night belonged to one man. The entire Lakers' strategy was elegantly simple: feed the giant. The Dallas defense collapsed inward, but it was too little, too late against a player at the absolute peak of his physical powers.

For the Mavericks, the night was one of pure frustration. Michael Finley’s 22 points were a valiant effort in a lost cause, a small fire against a tidal wave. The final score, 102-83, told only half the story. The full narrative was written in the stat line of one Shaquille O’Neal—46 points and 21 rebounds—a historic, dominant performance that reminded everyone why he remains the most formidable force in the game. It was a masterclass, a spectacle, and a statement all rolled into one unforgettable evening.
